effect.text: Switch 1 of your own Benched Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

requirements.description: Must have at least one benched Pokemon

tips: Essential in decks with high-retreat Pokemon like Chansey, Snorlax, or Mewtwo
Include 2-3 copies in decks that rely on Pokemon with retreat costs of 2+
Can be skipped in decks with mostly free-retreat or 1-retreat Pokemon
Excellent response to opponent's Gust of Wind bringing up an unprepared Pokemon
Allows you to use Pokemon with heavy retreat costs without Energy commitment
Can enable hit-and-run strategies with different attackers
Particularly valuable in the late game when Energy is scarce

rulings.ruling: Choose 1 Pokemon from your bench to switch with your Active Pokemon
The Active Pokemon moves to your bench, and the chosen benched Pokemon becomes active
You cannot play Switch if you have no benched Pokemon
This does not count as retreating - no retreat cost is paid
Any effects on the Active Pokemon that reference it being active may end when it moves to bench
Switch can be used even if your Active Pokemon is Asleep, Paralyzed, or Confused
You can switch to a Pokemon that has just been played that turn (no 'summoning sickness' rule)
Switch bypasses any effect that would prevent retreating
